channel.title: What would you spend the $8,500 on?
channel.description: Recently i won third prize in an art competition on ocean acidification, and won $8,500 for the school. Today, the principal approached me and said he wanted to talk to me about what school project i'd like to spend the money on. Personally, i have no clue what i could possibly put this to except for art supplies or maybe new computers in the art room. Any thoughts on what i could suggest to him?

item.title: What would you spend the $8,500 on?
item.dc:creator: @Muroth Muroth
item.description:
@Muroth wrote:

Host a ‘fun day’ for the whole school, musical instruments, art supplies, help the special education out, it all depends on what your school needs. Think about the upcoming students, what’s lacking at your school?

Read full topic
item.source: What would you spend the $8,500 on?

[quote=“Java-RSPS-Noob, post:22, topic:528073”][quote author=amy_webb link=topic=646822.msg4350407#msg4350407 date=1376544720]
I live in Australia, we don’t have Walmart.
[/quote]wow really… Australia looks better and better every time I talk to you[/quote]

It’s probably under a different name. Walmart is called Asda in the UK.

item.title: What would you spend the $8,500 on?
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

Better printers. I noticed for my photography class that the printers they have are gigantic and are actually really nice when you need to scan images etc, they have a system built in that once you scan your image it gets sent to your student email which is on your individual login user in Microsoft Outlook.

Oh so you live in Australia yeah? We’re going to smash you guys on Saturday. (All Blacks vs Wallabies)

Read full topic

@Rodgerwilco wrote:

item.source: What would you spend the $8,500 on?

item.title: What would you spend the $8,500 on?
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:12, topic:528073”][quote author=Java-RSPS-Noob link=topic=646822.msg4349903#msg4349903 date=1376484848]
As a person who studied educational administration. Let me explain something to you about “projects”

Just like in the government products cost more for the schools than it does for a regular person going to a store. You need to realize that something like furniture or a computer normally might cost us 100-200$ USD well in a school setting you can easily be looking at 450-500$ USD.

Have you considered making a “student fund” project. Where parents, students, and teachers alike can donate money to this fund. The fund would:

  1. Take funds out for death in family (where like flowers or something would be bought in honor of that student/teachers death)
  2. Take funds out for a minor percentage to go towards cost of student trophies(you would be surprised how much they cost the schooL!)
  3. Like monthly drives could be ran to help try to increase the coffers of the fund.

You will need a very responsible person to help set up and manage ( be the treasurer) of the funds so as to not go to low or too high.

I would also suggest talking with the principal about this in the depth as well cause there may or may not already be a similar system set forth. If there is you could always suggest to just donate to that project.
[/quote]You’re such a retard. Just stop posting.

Put it towards extra-curricular activities or your gym.[/quote]how is a student fund “retarded” Most business have a similar system set up for employees I don’t see why it can’t be done in a school. As a matter of fact, I know it is done in some schools.

So by your logic you’re the retard have a good day. :palm:

Edit: and the next time you call somebody a retard justify your reasoning.

Read full topic
item.source: What would you spend the $8,500 on?

item.title: What would you spend the $8,500 on?
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Buy a ton of paper and ink cartridges. Don’t let students buy that sort of stuff.

Read full topic
item.source: What would you spend the $8,500 on?

item.title: What would you spend the $8,500 on?
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

I like some of these suggestions like a school trip and recreational purposes, and i can suggest them but i don’t see it happening. I think the best i can do which might actually show effect is asking for art supplies.

Read full topic
item.source: What would you spend the $8,500 on?

item.title: What would you spend the $8,500 on?
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

Show them this thread and say the only viable option is to go on a school trip to another country with your class~

Things I can think of:

  • host lessons to get your driver’s license at school (for those who have the approperiate age)
  • add extra lessons (probably temporary, considering the budget) such as maybe a 3D class or somthing
  • recreational purposes (playground extension, a green field, trees, a garden would be such an awesome thing to have in a school)
  • (already suggested this I’ll say it again) a student’s room
  • more lockers incase you don’t have enough (or don’t have any)
  • school trip for your class to a destination of choice

Read full topic
item.source: What would you spend the $8,500 on?

item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“Java-RSPS-Noob, post:4, topic:528073”]As a person who studied educational administration. Let me explain something to you about “projects”

Just like in the government products cost more for the schools than it does for a regular person going to a store. You need to realize that something like furniture or a computer normally might cost us 100-200$ USD well in a school setting you can easily be looking at 450-500$ USD.

Have you considered making a “student fund” project. Where parents, students, and teachers alike can donate money to this fund. The fund would:

  1. Take funds out for death in family (where like flowers or something would be bought in honor of that student/teachers death)
  2. Take funds out for a minor percentage to go towards cost of student trophies(you would be surprised how much they cost the schooL!)
  3. Like monthly drives could be ran to help try to increase the coffers of the fund.

You will need a very responsible person to help set up and manage ( be the treasurer) of the funds so as to not go to low or too high.

I would also suggest talking with the principal about this in the depth as well cause there may or may not already be a similar system set forth. If there is you could always suggest to just donate to that project.[/quote]You’re such a retard. Just stop posting.

Put it towards extra-curricular activities or your gym.

item.title: What would you spend the $8,500 on?
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

We don’t have a photoshop class, we only have the basic subject like maths, art, english etc. The school is too poor to put it into a scholarship, also i don’t plan on doing further studies so it would be pointless. My principal usually doesn’t favour the older students, as i go to a p-12 college. Getting a them to dedicate the money to me would be extremely rare and improbable.

Thanks for the suggestions though, i’d suggest them if i went to a normal school.

Read full topic
item.source: What would you spend the $8,500 on?

some dont have them

item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

[quote=“amy_webb, post:5, topic:528073”]You might not have understood properly, he asked my opinion on where i’d like the money to go. That doesn’t mean i have the final decision and considering my school is poor, i doubt that would ever happen. I’m in my last weeks of year 12, nothing i suggest will benefit me in any way, the only reason why they’re asking is because i won it for them.[/quote]the fund is a nice idea still as it could be something that could even last for years to come for the school overall. I would at least throw the idea out to them and see what they say.

item.title: What would you spend the $8,500 on?
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

As a person who studied educational administration. Let me explain something to you about “projects”

Just like in the government products cost more for the schools than it does for a regular person going to a store. You need to realize that something like furniture or a computer normally might cost us 100-200$ USD well in a school setting you can easily be looking at 450-500$ USD.

Have you considered making a “student fund” project. Where parents, students, and teachers alike can donate money to this fund. The fund would:

  1. Take funds out for death in family (where like flowers or something would be bought in honor of that student/teachers death)
  2. Take funds out for a minor percentage to go towards cost of student trophies(you would be surprised how much they cost the schooL!)
  3. Like monthly drives could be ran to help try to increase the coffers of the fund.

You will need a very responsible person to help set up and manage ( be the treasurer) of the funds so as to not go to low or too high.

I would also suggest talking with the principal about this in the depth as well cause there may or may not already be a similar system set forth. If there is you could always suggest to just donate to that project.

Read full topic
item.source: What would you spend the $8,500 on?

item.title: What would you spend the $8,500 on?
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

I wish, the teacher are really tight about students having independent space. I’m not sure if anyone has heard of an open learning community, but basically we don’t even have divided rooms. We just have furniture assigned to one place with a name like A2 which indicates a class room.

Read full topic
item.source: What would you spend the $8,500 on?

item.title: What would you spend the $8,500 on?
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

A student’s room. Throw in some furniture, maybe a PS3, a couple lockers, etc… Just ask to ‘pimp’ an unused room and only let certain people in
If you don’t feel like being annoyed with some fags stealing the PS3… Investing in better computers or 2D/3D software should be well worth it? :o

Read full topic
